name: Exercise Motivation - Sedentary Lifestyle
description: A 52-year-old office worker whose doctor has strongly recommended exercise for health reasons
demographics: 52-year-old male, married, IT manager, two adult children who have moved out
presenting_issue: Sedentary lifestyle with no regular exercise, doctor recommending activity after concerning bloodwork

change: Doctor said pre-diabetic and blood pressure is borderline high
Wife wants them to be active together in retirement
Realizes he has more free time now that kids are gone
Doesn't want to end up on medications his father took
status_quo: Exhausted after work - just want to sit down
Never been athletic, don't know where to start
Gym memberships are expensive and I'd just waste the money
Bad knee makes most exercise painful
Too self-conscious to exercise in public at this weight

background: Was moderately active in his 20s (played recreational basketball) but stopped when career and kids took priority. Has been mostly sedentary for 20+ years. Recently had a physical that showed elevated blood sugar and blood pressure. Doctor gave a stern talk about lifestyle changes. Has tried to start exercising a few times but never stuck with it past a couple weeks. Had a knee injury 10 years ago that still bothers him.
personality_notes: Self-deprecating sense of humor about his fitness level. Logical thinker who likes concrete plans. Feels guilty about his health but also overwhelmed about changing. Doesn't like being told what to do but respects expertise. Tends to catastrophize about starting - imagines he needs to run marathons when walking would help.
potential_change_talk_triggers: Discussing what retirement with his wife might look like
Exploring activities that don't require a gym
Talking about what he enjoyed about basketball back in the day
Breaking down exercise into smaller, less intimidating steps
Discussing what 'good enough' might look like vs. perfection
common_sustain_talk: I've tried before and it never sticks
I'm just not a gym person
By the time I get home, I have no energy
My knee won't let me do much anyway
Maybe I'll start in the spring when the weather's better
opening_statement: My doctor basically told me I need to exercise or I'm going to end up diabetic like my dad. So here I am. I know I should do something, I just... every time I think about it, I don't even know where to start. And honestly, I've tried before and it never lasts.
